data.title: The Great Train Robbery by Crichton, Michael, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Great Train Robbery by Crichton, Michael and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: VG. Dust Jacket Condition: VG. First Edition UK. A unique documentary approach to the novel of suspense told in fascinating detail: Once a month the gold bullion is boarded on a London train bound for Paris. Then, one month, the train arrives at Paris - empty. Author, Michael Chrichton, educated Harvard [ The Adromeda Strain/Terminal Man ] VG/VG [ Book- clean throughout, no inscs., sound binding, slight spine lean, tan to end papers] Dust Jacket not clipped, bright and clean, No fade- taking image lightens colours- to wrap-around-scene- design Leigh Taylor [& book spine is not marked- just the glint from the gilt train spine illustration].

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. This is a Very Good Copy of this hardcover book in a Very Good Dust-Jacket with small repaired closed tear to the head of spine and one closed tear to base of spine,and with light rubbing to extremities of the dust-jacket.Price clipped and this copy has one previous inscription present to the front endpaper.The dust-jacket comes well protected in a removable cover sleeve.8vo 266pp First Edition 1st Impression [1975].

Hardcover. Condition: Good +. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition/First Printing. An ex-library copy with some of the usual defects normally associated to an ex-library. The 7.95 priced jacket has some glue residue to reverse of both flaps with some bleed thorugh, short crease to rear flap. Actually not too bad for an ex-library jacket. THIS COPY IS IN MY POSSESSION AND NORMALLY SHIPS NEXT DAY. Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. 1st printing. A copy with clean, unmarked pages, a slight lean to the spine and light foxing on the edges in a nice price-clipped jacket with light wear around the edges, but no tears or chips.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First edition, stated. A good copy with some fading and spotting in a very good DJ protected in removable mylar cover. See my photos of the book you will receive, not stock photos. More available upon request. This book is in my possession and will be packed in bubble wrap and shipped in a cardboard box. USPS tracking provided. #37.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition. Second Printing before Publication . So stated. Book is in Near Fine condition. Boards are clean, fading along the top edge, not bumped. Fore edges have a small amount of reading wear. Interior is clean and legible. Not remaindered. Dust Jacket is in Fine condition. Not chipped or crinkled. Some light discoloration along the folds. Not price clipped. Dustjacket is covered by mylar wrapper. All-ways well boxed, All-ways fast service. Thanks. Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. First Edition. 1st edition 1st printing - minor wear to edge of dust jacket - owner's name cut out of front end paper - some sun fade to cover - binding out of square - otherwise binding strong contents clean - enjoy.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. First U. S. edition, first printing, hardcover. Quarter-bound in brown cloth with gilt titles on spine/brown paper-covered boards. 266 pages. Good with head/tail of spine bumped, boards discolored, rubbing to front cover near bottom edge, and endpapers tanned, in a very good dust jacket with edge wear. Mylar cover on jacket.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First edition first printing of this thriller novel that became the 1978 movie of the same name starring Sean Connery and Donald Sutherland. Light shelf wear. Slight spine slant. Price clipped otherwise in very good / near fine condition. BRColl.

First edition and first printing. Hardcover. Crichton's fourth book published using his own name. The basis for the 1979 movie with Sean Connery and Donald Sutherland. A tight close to near fine with some of the usual tanning to the edges of the paper covered boards and a former owner's rubberstamp name to the rear pastedown in a near fine price clipped dust jacket with some very minor wear.

Hard Cover. First Edition. This is a true US first edition / first printing, with the words 'Published by Alfred A Knopf.inc in 1975' on the copyright page. A Near-Fine copy of this thrilling novel, by the blockbusting author of 'Jurassic Park'. The jacket is nestly price-clipped. There is some slight fading to the jacket spine (hardly noticeable). Otherwise, very nice. We protect all our books with a removable plastic cover, and send them with care.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First edition stated first printing of a fine hardcover in a near fine dustjacket which has been price clipped. Featuring Edward Pierce, along with his accomplices, who attempt to rob the London To Paris train, laden with gold bullion in 1855. The basis for the 1978 film of the same name starring Sean Connery.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good +. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good +. First Edition. First Printing. Book is clean and tight and would be Fine but for some sunning to top of boards. Jacket has only the slightest edge wear, but no tears. Panels are bright and clean. Price has been square cut out with scissors. A very nice copy of Crichton's fourth book.

Hardcover. First Edition. 266pp. Cloth backed boards. Basis for Michael Crichton's 1979 movie featuring Sean Connery, Donald Sutherland and Lesley-Anne Down. Softening to spine ends, slightly yellowed endpapers, board edges are a bit faded. A near fine copy in near fine dustjacket with mild edge wear and nick to upper edge of spine panel.; Octavo.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition. Based on fact, as lively as legend, and studded with all the suspense and style of a modern fiction master, here is a classic caper novel set a decade before the age of dynamite yet nonetheless explosive.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First edition. Some sunning around the edges of the boards, else near fine plus in fine price-clipped dustwrapper.
